slides.title: Learning Objectives
slides.content:
By the end of this module, you will be able to:

  1. Build image classification systems
  2. Understand object detection architectures (YOLO, Faster R-CNN)
  3. Implement semantic segmentation with U-Net
  4. Evaluate models using IoU, mAP, and other metrics
  5. Apply transfer learning for computer vision tasks

slides.title: Image Classification
slides.content: Assigning labels to images

slides.title: MNIST Dataset
slides.content: MNIST: 70,000 handwritten digits (28×28 grayscale). The "Hello World" of deep learning.

slides.title: CIFAR-10 Dataset
slides.content: CIFAR-10: 60,000 color images (32×32) in 10 classes. More challenging than MNIST.

slides.title: CNN for Classification
slides.content:
Classification Pipeline:
Conv layers → Feature extraction
FC layers → Classification
Softmax → Probability distribution over classes

slides.content: What the CNN learns at different layers

slides.title: Training and Evaluation
slides.content: Monitor: Loss and accuracy on train/val sets. Gap indicates overfitting.

slides.title: Confusion Matrix
slides.content:
Metrics from confusion matrix:

  • Precision = TP / (TP + FP)
  • Recall = TP / (TP + FN)
  • F1 = 2 × (Precision × Recall) / (Precision + Recall)

slides.title: Object Detection
slides.content: Finding and localizing objects

slides.title: Object Detection Task
slides.content:
Object Detection: Not just "what" but "where".

Output: Class label + Bounding box (x, y, width, height)

slides.title: YOLO Architecture
slides.content:
YOLO (You Only Look Once):

  • Single-shot detector - very fast
  • Divides image into grid cells
  • Each cell predicts B boxes + class probabilities
  • Real-time detection possible

knowledgeCheck.question: Why is YOLO faster than two-stage detectors like Faster R-CNN?
knowledgeCheck.answer: YOLO processes the entire image in one forward pass through the network, directly predicting bounding boxes and classes. Two-stage detectors first generate region proposals, then classify each proposal, requiring multiple network evaluations.

slides.title: Faster R-CNN
slides.content:
Two-stage detector:
  1. Region Proposal Network (RPN): Generate candidate boxes
  2. Classification head: Classify and refine boxes

More accurate but slower than YOLO.

slides.title: IoU (Intersection over Union)
slides.content:
IoU: Measures overlap between predicted and ground truth boxes.

$$IoU = \frac{\text{Area of Intersection}}{\text{Area of Union}}$$

IoU > 0.5 typically considered a "correct" detection.

slides.title: Non-Maximum Suppression
slides.content:
NMS: Remove duplicate detections.

  1. Sort boxes by confidence
  2. Keep highest confidence box
  3. Remove boxes with IoU > threshold
  4. Repeat for remaining boxes

slides.title: Mean Average Precision
slides.content:
mAP: Standard metric for object detection.
Average of Average Precision (AP) across all classes.
AP = Area under Precision-Recall curve.

slides.title: Semantic Segmentation
slides.content: Pixel-level classification

slides.title: Segmentation Types
slides.content:
Semantic
Classify every pixel
No instance distinction
Instance
Separate each object
Distinguishes individuals

knowledgeCheck.question: What is the difference between semantic and instance segmentation?
knowledgeCheck.answer: Semantic segmentation labels each pixel with a class but doesn't distinguish between different instances of the same class. Instance segmentation identifies each individual object separately (e.g., person 1, person 2).

slides.title: U-Net Architecture
slides.content:
U-Net: Encoder-decoder with skip connections.

  • Encoder: Downsample, extract features
  • Decoder: Upsample, recover spatial detail
  • Skip connections: Preserve fine details

slides.content: Input image and pixel-wise segmentation output

slides.title: Implementation
slides.content:
import torch
import torchvision.models as models

# Transfer learning with pretrained ResNet
model = models.resnet18(pretrained=True)

# Freeze feature extractor
for param in model.parameters():
    param.requires_grad = False

# Replace classifier for new task
model.fc = torch.nn.Linear(512, num_classes)

# Object detection with torchvision
from torchvision.models.detection import fasterrcnn_resnet50_fpn
detector = fasterrcnn_resnet50_fpn(pretrained=True)

slides.title: Summary
slides.content: Key Takeaways

slides.title: Key Takeaways
slides.content:
1. Classification: Assign single label per image
  2. Object Detection: YOLO (fast), Faster R-CNN (accurate)
  3. IoU & NMS: Essential for evaluating and refining detections
  4. mAP: Standard detection evaluation metric
  5. Segmentation: Pixel-level classification (U-Net)
  6. Transfer learning: Leverage pretrained models
